      • minStringIndex

        public static int minStringIndex(int a,
                                 int b)
        Returns the minimal index into a String, exempting the -1 constant. Examples:
        • minStringIndex(-1, 2) == 2
        • minStringIndex(3, -1) == 3
        • minStringIndex(5, 12) == 5
        • minStringIndex(-1, -1) == -1
        Parameters:
        a - index1
        b - index2
        Returns:
        minimal index.

        Splits a text into separate parts delimited by the separator characters
        Parameters:
        text - to split
        Returns:
        split parts

      • canInstantlyBreakMinecart

        public static boolean canInstantlyBreakMinecart(org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
        Gets whether a particular entity is in a state of destroying minecarts instantly. This is when they are in creative mode, and only when not sneaking (players).
        Parameters:
        entity - to check
        Returns:
        True if the entity can instantly destroy a minecart, False if not

        Parameters:

        face - to check
        Returns:
        True if supported, False if not

      • calculateStraightLength

        public static double calculateStraightLength(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock,
                                             org.bukkit.block.BlockFace direction)
        Obtains the maximum straight length achieved from a particular block. This length is limited to 20 blocks.
        Parameters:
        railsBlock - to calculate from
        direction - to look into, use SELF to check all possible directions
        Returns:
        straight length

      • parseTimeTicks

        public static int parseTimeTicks(java.lang.String text)
        Attempts to parse the text as time ticks, converting values such as '12s' and '500ms' into ticks. If no time statement is found, -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        text - to parse as time
        Returns:
        time ticks, or -1 if not parsed

      • getUnicode

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        hexcode, in unicode format

      • getCleanLine

        public static java.lang.String getCleanLine(org.bukkit.event.block.SignChangeEvent event,
                                            int line)
        Reads a line from a sign change event and clears characters that can't be parsed by TC. If the line contains no invalid characters, the exact same String is returned without the overhead of allocating a new String. If the line is null, an empty String is returned instead. A null event will also result in an empty String.
        Parameters:
        event - to get a clean line of
        line - index
        Returns:
        clean line of the sign, guaranteed to never be null or have invalid characters

      • getCleanLine

        public static java.lang.String getCleanLine(org.bukkit.block.Sign sign,
                                            int line)
        Reads a line from a sign and clears characters that can't be parsed by TC. If the line contains no invalid characters, the exact same String is returned without the overhead of allocating a new String. If the line is null, an empty String is returned instead. A null sign will also result in an empty String.
        Parameters:
        sign - to get a clean line of
        line - index
        Returns:
        clean line of the sign, guaranteed to never be null or have invalid characters

      • cleanSignLine

        public static java.lang.String cleanSignLine(java.lang.String line)
        Clears input of characters that can't be parsed by TC. If the line contains no invalid characters, the exact same String is returned without the overhead of allocating a new String. If the line is null, an empty String is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        line - to parse
        Returns:
        line cleared from invalid characters

      • cleanSignLines

        public static java.lang.String[] cleanSignLines(java.lang.String[] lines)
        Clears input sign lines of characters that can't be parsed by TC. If none of the lines contain invalid characters, the exact same String[] array is returned without the overhead of allocating a new String[] array. If the input array is null, or its length is not 4, it is resized so it is using a newly allocated array. The lines are guaranteed to not be null.
        Parameters:
        lines - to parse
        Returns:
        lines cleared from invalid characters

      • isInvalidCharacter

        public static boolean isInvalidCharacter(char c)
        Checks whether a particular character is valid on TrainCarts signs. Control codes and other unsupported characters return True.
        Parameters:
        c - character to test
        Returns:
        True if the character is invalid

        Parameters:
        angleOld -
        angleNew -
        Returns:
        angle of the rotation performed

      • calculateEnterFace

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace calculateEnterFace(org.bukkit.util.Vector position,
                                                            org.bukkit.util.Vector direction)
        Calculates the face of a block that is first entered when moving in a direction from a position. The movement is that of an infinite line. The face first hit is returned. The position is relative to the block.
        Parameters:
        position - x/y/z of the position relative to the block
        direction - x/y/z of the direction in which is moved
        Returns:
        face of the block first entered

                                                     org.bukkit.util.Vector up1,
                                                     double theta)
        Linearly interpolates an orientation 'up' vector between two stages, performing a clean rotation between the two.
        Parameters:
        up0 -
        up1 -
        theta -
        Returns:
        orientation up-vector at theta

      • getNextPos

        public static org.bukkit.block.Block getNextPos(org.bukkit.block.Block railBlock,
                                                org.bukkit.block.BlockFace direction)
        Calculates the next Minecart block position when going on a rail block in a particular direction. This logic is largely deprecated and is only used in places where there is no alternative possible yet.
        Parameters:
        railBlock -
        direction -
        Returns:
        next minecart Block position, null if no such rail exists

      • markChunkDirty

        public static final void markChunkDirty(org.bukkit.Chunk chunk)
        Marks a chunk as dirty, so that it is saved again when it unloads
        Parameters:
        chunk -

      • faceToJunction

        public static RailJunction faceToJunction(java.util.List<RailJunction> junctions,
                                          org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Attempts to find the most appropriate junction for a BlockFace wind direction. This is used when switcher signs have to switch rails based on wind directions, but no wind direction names are used for the junction names. This is also used for sign-relative left/right/forward/backward logic, which is first turned into a BlockFace.
        Parameters:
        junctions - to select from
        face - to find
        Returns:
        the best matching junction, null if not found

      • loadInventoryFromConfig

        public static void loadInventoryFromConfig(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inventory,
                                           com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.config.ConfigurationNode config)
        Checks for a 'contents' field in the configuration, and if it exists, loads all items contained within. The inventory is wiped beforehand.
        Parameters:
        inventory -
        config -

      • saveInventoryToConfig

        public static void saveInventoryToConfig(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inventory,
                                         com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.config.ConfigurationNode config)
        Saves all items in the inventory to the configuration under a 'contents' field. If the inventory is empty, nothing is saved.
        Parameters:
        inventory -
        config -
